head.supplied: ¶ [Mr. Fletcher exhibited … specimens of eighteen species of plants from the Cobar district, collected and presented to the Society by Rev. J. Milne Curran, F.G.S., among which are a number recorded ...

div.p:
Letter not found. The text given here is from 'Notes and exhibits', Proceedings of the Linnean Society of New South Wales , vol. 13, 1889, p. 425. The collection was shown at the meeting of 25 April 1888, but the letter is dated to 1887 as the latest date Curran's specimens could have been sent to have been listed in B88.07.03, read to the Royal Society of Victoria on 12 December 1887.
[Mr. Fletcher exhibited … specimens of eighteen species of plants from the Cobar district, collected and presented to the Society by Rev. J. Milne Curran, F.G.S., among which are a number recorded from N.S.W. for the first time by Baron von Mueller (see Proc. Roy. Soc. of Victoria for 1887), from specimens sent him by Mr. Curran.]
